thread.title: Area Roundup 10-15-15: Granite Hills volleyball still undefeated in DSL
thread.title_full: Area Roundup 10-15-15: Granite Hills volleyball still undefeated in DSL

author: Staff Reports
title: Area Roundup 10-15-15: Granite Hills volleyball still undefeated in DSL
text: Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:43 PM Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:43 PM » Social News VICTORVILLE — The Granite Hills volleyball team has played eight Desert Sky League games and won them all, the latest a three-game sweep of Silverado on Thursday. The Cougars (8-0 DSL) won the first set 25-7 win and followed that up with wins of 25-8 and 25-22. Lauren Wilson led Granite Hills in kills with 10, while Alicia Christensen added six. Leah Wiggington had six kills and 15 digs, and Casey Hele contributed a balanced effort of 18 assists, five aces and 15 digs for the Cougars. Jaclyn Ranow added 10 digs. Granite Hills begins the third round of DSL play at Adelanto on Tuesday. Silverado has Tuesday off and will host Adelanto on Oct. 22. Prep Girls Tennis Serrano 16, Sultana 2 At Hesperia, Serrano won all nine singles sets behind three-set sweeps by Madeline Cortez, Aliyah Ellis and Jessie Kim. Catie Williams and Morgan McDonald teamed up to win two sets in doubles for Sultana (1-10 MRL), which plays at Hesperia on Tuesday. Serrano Singles Cortez 6-0, 6-0, 6-0; A. Ellis 6-1, 6-0, 6-0; Kim 6-0, 6-2, 6-0. Serrano Doubles Slocumb-K Ellis 6-0, 6-0, Olson-Serna 6-4; Tarver-Windward 6-0, 6-0, Gonzalez-Ford 0-6; Evans-Tran 2-6, 6-0, 6-1. Sultana Singles Vargas 0-6, 1-6, 0-6; A. Johnson 0-6, 0-6, 2-6; L. Johnson 0-6, 0-6, 0-6. Sultana Doubles C. Williams-McDonald 0-6, 6-0, 6-2; D. Williams-Baker 0-6, 0-6, 0-6; Farias-Gomez 4-6, 0-6, 1-6. Hesperia 11, Apple Valley 7 At Apple Valley, the Scorpions won a Mojave River League match against the Sun Devils. Apple Valley (4-8) hosts Burroughs on Tuesday. Hesperia Singles M. Smith 7-6 (10), 6-2, 6-1; C. Smith 6-4, 6-1, 1-6; Sanchez 4-6, 0-6, 6-1. Hesperia Doubles Aguilar-Connoley 6-7 (4), 6-3, 6-2; Chum-Ruvacarba 6-3, 6-1, forfeit; Garcia-Medina 6-2, 2-6, Aguilara-Espinoza 1-6. Apple Valley Singles Corey 6-7 (10), 6-0, 6-1; Sanchez 4-6, 2-6, 1-6; Hathaway 6-4, 1-6, 1-6. Apple Valley Doubles Webb-Conrad 7-6 (4), 6-2, won by forfeit; Romero-Fernandez 3-6, 3-6, Doran-Fernandez 1-6; Stine-Aguilar 2-6, 1-6, 2-6. Burroughs 10, Oak Hills 8 At Ridgecrest, the Bulldogs lost a Mojave River League match despite a sweep in doubles from Robin Smith and Justine Torres. Oak Hills (10-5, 7-5 MRL) plays at Serrano on Tuesday. Oak Hills Singles K. Heredia 3-6, 6-2, 6-1; McMahon 2-6, 2-6, Gonzalez 0-6; Moreno 2-6, 1-6, 2-6. Oak Hills Doubles Evans-B. Heredia 2-6, 6-3, 6-1; Brar-Akoh 5-7, 6-3, Hill-Hubbard 2-6; Smith-Torres 6-2, 6-4, 6-0. Silverado 16, Adelanto 2 At Victorville, the Hawks easily beat the Saints at home. Shenna Panitan swept her two sets 6-0, 6-0 and Alondra Navarro won 6-1, 6-1. In doubles, Jackie Garcia and Jessica Reyes went 6-0, 6-1. Silverado (8-5, 5-3 Desert Sky League) wraps up a busy week with a 6 p.m. Friday match against Rim of the World at home. Adelanto Singles Macias 1-6, 0-6, 1-6; Lopez 1-6, 0-6, 1-6; Gabriel 2-6, 1-6, 1-6. Adelanto Doubles Solomon-Bobadilla 1-6, 2-6, 6-7 (4); Mercardo-Gonzalez 6-3, 1-6, 0-6; Salgado-Salguero 1-6, 0-6; Frank-Salguero 6-4. Silverado Singles Abdulfattah 6-1, 6-2; Ziranda 6-1; Panitan 6-0, 6-0; Cox 6-1; Navarro 6-1, 6-1; Bagnol 6-1. Silverado Doubles Ford-Carrillo 6-1, 6-0; Cervantes-Castro 3-6; Fox-Williams 6-2, 6-1; Hardy-Alberto 4-6; Garcia-Reyes 6-0, 6-1; Monge-Hernandez 7-6 (4). Prep Girls Volleyball AAE 3, Riverside Prep 1 At Oro Grande, the Knights won a Cross Valley League match. AAE lost the first set 17-25 but came back to win the next three 25-12, 26-24 and 25-15. Kelsey Bryant posted two assists, one ace, 12 digs and one kill for the Knights. Hannah Lopatriello notched an ace, seven digs and nine kills and Megan Gruenwald contributed an ace and 11 digs. “(Gruenwald) was a practice player for us last year and she’s stepped up to varsity and had some big games for us this year,” said AAE coach Tiffany Parker. Carolina Phillips also got in on the action for the Knights with an ace, 22 kills and 12 digs. Mary Castillo posted 12 digs, Emily Gruver had 31 assists, 16 digs and four kills, Carley Wallenburg added three aces, three digs and two kills, Claire Kelly posted three assists, a dig, four kills and two blocks and Madysen Baker added 10 kills and five blocks. The Silver Knights’ Tatiana Barajas chipped in 14 digs, Cierra Berger posted three kills and 11 digs and Breanna Pedrin added six kills and nine digs. Riverside Prep (8-8-2, 3-5 CVL) plays at University Prep on Tuesday, while AAE (11-5, 7-1 CVL) plays at Excelsior on the same day. University Prep 3, Cobalt Institute of Math and Science 0 At Victorville, the Jaguars swept CIMS 25-8, 25-3 and 25-10. Jennifer Lopez had five aces and three digs for University Prep. Lillian Lopez notched three kills and seven assists and Lakenya Riley posted eight aces and four digs. CIMS (0-2) plays at ACE on Tuesday. University Prep (13-3-1, 7-1 Cross Valley League) hosts Riverside Prep on Tuesday. Excelsior 3, ACE 1 At Victorville, Excelsior hung on to beat ACE in a Cross Valley League match. Excelsior won the first two sets 25-20 and 25-23 before dropping the third 21-25. They went on to win the match-deciding set 24-26. ACE’s Anna Menough had four aces, four kills, one block and seven assists; Ariel Stallings posted three aces, three kills and a block; Julie Molina had nine kills, one block and three assists; Gaby Gonzalez notched two kills and seven assists; Makayla Simmons contributed an ace, two kills and a block; Elizabeth Bagley had four kills; and Priscilla Fuentes added a block, a kill and an assist. For Excelsior, Grace Bergevin posted 12 kills, one ace and 11 digs; McKenna Lindsay added two blocks and six kills; Kaelani Brooks posted 14 assists and two aces; Olivia Hidalgo contributed 12 assists and three kills. ACE (0-8 CVL) hosts CIMS on Tuesday while Excelsior (3-5 CVL) hosts AAE. Apple Valley Christian 3, Victor Valley Christian 1 At Apple Valley, the Warriors beat the Royals in an Agape League game. Apple Valley Christian won the first set 25-14, dropped the second 20-25 and came back to win the next two 25-23 and 25-17. Marissa Covarubias notched six kills, three digs and an ace for Apple Valley Christian; Brina Spidle added 18 digs, six kills, five aces and two assists; and Lizzie Trujillo had 10 assists, eight digs and a pair of kills and aces. Jasmine Lara posted a pair of kills, two blocks and a dig for VVCS; Charlotte Cortez contributed a kill, two aces, two digs and a pair of blocks; and Ellie Gerbracht had 14 kills, 11 aces and 15 digs. The Royals (1-6, 1-4 Agape League) play at Lucerne Valley on Tuesday. The Warriors (3-9, 3-2 Agape League) host Bethel Christian/Lancaster. Lucerne Valley 3, Hesperia Christian 0 At Lucerne Valley, the Mustangs swept the Patriots in an Agape League match. Lucerne Valley won all three sets 25-20. Brooke Johnson had six assists and seven digs for the Patriots; Kayli Klasa contributed four assists and four kills; Mia Williams added three kills; and Ashley Woods had nine digs. Hesperia Christian (8-4, 4-1 Agape League) plays at Antelope Valley Christian on Tuesday. Prep Boys Volleyball Redlands Adventist Academy 3, Apple Valley Christian 1 At Apple Valley, the Warriors lost in four sets 25-10, 25-17, 23-25, 26-24. Zach Richart led Apple Valley Christian with 11 kills and four assists. Khanh Messner tallied seven kills and Noah Leslie added 15 assists. The Warriors (2-7) play Tuesday at La Sierra Academy. By Staff Reports Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 10:43 PM " data-width="650" data-numposts="20" data-colorscheme="light"> » STAY INFORMED
